Dialogue: Wade! Come in! Have a cup of coffee.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: You got yourself a computer, Alma.

Speaker: alma
Dialogue: Been putting my files into it. You take sugar and milk?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: No. Black.

Speaker: alma
Dialogue: Are you alright, Wade?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Yeah, sure. Why? I got this damned tooth, I got a few things bugging me, like everybody else. But I'm okay.

Speaker: alma
Dialogue: Well, you look... sad. Upset. I don't mean to pry. I'm sorry about your mother. It was a nice funeral.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Alma, I think there's some dirty business going on in this town.

Speaker: alma
Dialogue: Always has been.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: This is maybe worse than you and I are used to.  What I'm talking about, I'm talking about murder. Among other things.

Speaker: alma
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Evan Twombley, the union boss who got shot. Somebody murdered him.

Speaker: alma
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: You know Jack Hewitt, the kid I work with?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: ...if Jack told the truth, he could be free by the time he's my age.

Speaker: alma
Dialogue: Sometimes things are simpler than you think. Let me ask you a question.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: You don't believe me?

Speaker: alma
Dialogue: About Jack? No. Have you checked out the tax bill on your father's farm lately?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: I know he's due for the last two years. I was thinking of paying it when the insurance comes in.

Speaker: alma
Dialogue: Has anybody offered to buy it?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: As a mater of fact, yes. LaRiviere.

Speaker: alma
Dialogue: This is all the real estate transactions in this town the last year. Most of it unused land. Most of it for little more than the back taxes owed.

Speaker: alma
Dialogue: This is from three years ago. Some difference, huh?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: What is the Northcountry Development Association?

Speaker: alma
Dialogue: I went down to Concord to check it out. The president is Mel Gordon. The vice-president and treasurer is Gordon LaRiviere. Those boys are buying up the mountain, Wade. $364,000 this year. I believe that's out of LaRiviere's league.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Twombley involved?

Speaker: alma
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: He musta found out. They had to get rid of him. And Jack'll get blamed.

Speaker: alma
Dialogue: All the figures show is that Gordon LaRiviere is going to be a very rich man using his position as Selectman. In a year or two, you won't recognize this town.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: You sneaky sonofabitch! I've got your number now, Gordon! All these years I actually thought you were a decent man.  Can you believe that?

Speaker: lariviere
Dialogue: Wade, you're done.  Let me have the shop keys.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Jesus Christ, Jack, don't you see that?

Speaker: lariviere
Dialogue: The key, Wade.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Yeah, you can have the key. It's the key that's kept me locked to you all these years. I give it to you with pleasure.  I've got to call my brother.

Speaker: chick
Dialogue: The good news is we haven't got to your car yet. The bad news --

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Just tell me when you'll have it fixed.

Speaker: chick
Dialogue: -- the bad news is there's a problem with Gordon's truck what somebody drove through the ice last night. Figured you'd know something about that, Wade.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Yeah. I know about that.

Speaker: chick
Dialogue: LaRiviere says he ain't gonna pay for the fixin' of your car. A couple hundred for the clutch. I got some more bad news. Wanna hear it?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Tell me.

Speaker: chick
Dialogue: Chub says you're fired.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: He can't fire me. LaRiviere already did that this morning.

Speaker: chick
Dialogue: He's a Selectman. The town. He said to tell you to turn your badge in and clean out your office. I'm supposed to pull the CB and police light out of your car. They're town property.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: What do you mean, you can't take me today? I told you --

Speaker: margie
Dialogue: What on earth is happening to you? Why are you acting this way?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: It's my tooth! My fucking tooth! I can't even think anymore because of it.

Speaker: margie
Dialogue: I heard you talking. You got fired this morning, didn't you?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Look, that's temporary, believe me. There's so much shit gonna hit the fan the next few days, my getting fired by LaRiviere and Merritt won't matter a bit.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: I'll get another job. People are going to need me. After this is over, they'll make me into a Goddamned hero. You wait: you'll see, I'll deliver. I'll be the best father who ever lived. You need me, even Pop, for Christ's sake, he needs me. This town needs me. Maybe now they think they can send me howling into a corner like a kicked dog, but my God, it'll be different soon.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Leave the bottle out!

Speaker: lillian
Dialogue: Wait there. She'll be right out.  Is there snow on the ground up in Lawford?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Yeah, lots.

Speaker: lillian
Dialogue: See. Get your boots.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Hi honey.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: lillian
Dialogue: Have her back tomorrow night by six.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: No problem. Look, I...

Speaker: lillian
Dialogue: You make me sick. I can't believe you've sunk so low.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Low as what? What have I done? It's bad to want to see your own daughter?

Speaker: lillian
Dialogue: You know what I'm talking about. For what you're doing to me and to the child you say you love so much. Love. You won't get away with it.

Speaker: lillian
Dialogue: Bye, honey! Call me tonight if you want.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Are we going in this?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Yeah. My car's in the shop. This'll be fine.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: It's pretty old.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: It belongs to Pop.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Pop?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Grandpa. My father. It's his.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: How about a Big Mac?

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Mommy won't let me eat fast food. You know that. It's bad for you.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: C'mon, we can always sneak a Big Mac. And a cherry turnover. Your favorite. What do you say?

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: What do you want, then?

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: You can't have nothing, Jill. We need lunch. Mr. Pizza?

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Same thing, Daddy. Mommy says --

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: I know what Mommy says. I'm in charge today, though.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Okay. So we'll get what you want. What do you want?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Nothing, I guess. I guess I can wait till we get home. Maybe we'll stop by Wickham's for a hamburger when we get to Lawford. That suit you? You always like Wickham's.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Fine.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Oh, Jesus, Jill, I'm sorry. What's the matter, honey?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Please don't cry. Please, honey.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: What are you sorry for?

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: I don't know. For the food business. I guess. I just thought, you know, we'd sneak a Big Mac on Mommy, like we used to.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: I want to go home.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: You can't.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: That's illegal, you know.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: You're a policeman.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Nope. Not anymore. I'm nothing anymore.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Jillie, you want a cheese grilled sandwich?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It's called a grilled cheese sandwich, you dub.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Jill, please, it's alright. Nothing happened.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: I want to go home.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Okay, let's go home, then.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Jack Hewitt, he's looking for you. Wants you to clear your stuff out of his office in Town Hall.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: His office. You mean my old office.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Well, I guess -- that's what he said.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: He got his deer yet?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No, he's out now. Somewhere on the mountain. I'd stay away from him if I were you. He's real pissed.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Going somewhere, Margie?

Speaker: margie
Dialogue: I'm just cleaning out some of this stuff that's built up. For the rummage sale. And some things for the cleaners. And the laundromat.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Don't lie to me. You're leaving me, I can see that.

Speaker: margie
Dialogue: Don't be silly. Hi, Jill.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Marg.

Speaker: margie
Dialogue: Leave me alone! Leave me alone!

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Leave her alone! Leave her alone!

Speaker: margie
Dialogue: Get in.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: I want to go home. Will you take me home?

Speaker: margie
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: pop
Dialogue: Yeah, you goddamn sonofabitch, I know you. You're a goddamn fucking piece of my heart!

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: So fuck you. Fuck you.

Speaker: pop
Dialogue: Nah-nah-naw! You done done finally done it! Like a man done it. Done it right. I love you, you mean sonofabitch!

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Love! What the fuck do you know about love?

Speaker: pop
Dialogue: Love! I'm made of love!

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Call it what you want.

Speaker: pop
Dialogue: Everything you know is from me.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: pop
Dialogue: Bang!

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: You and me.

Speaker: pop
Dialogue: Where the Christ you going? You sonofabitch, you leave my fucking truck where it is! I need... Give me the Goddamn keys! I need to get me to town!

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Crawl!

Speaker: pop
Dialogue: Nothing in the fucking house to drink. Not a fucking thing. My house, my money, my truck -- stolen!

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: I don't know you. My goddamn father and I don't know you.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: I know you now. I love you too.

Speaker: wade
Dialogue: Joke. You scared me.
